alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 3:50PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Henry, north central Van Buren and southeastern Jefferson Counties through 415 PM CST... At 350 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairfield, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lockridge and Rome around 400 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
